subject: Hb pro
description_text:
Just had bought the hb pro, and had major warping of the bolt that the goes
thru the load cell. Its a fairly high probability that it wasn't nothing
but user error, but was needing to know that bolt size so I can get a
replacement.

conversations.body_text: Actually got to looking at it closer and the the plate that the load cell mounts to appears to have split at right at the holes where load cell attaches at. I am in need of the load cell mounting plate, and new bolt for the spring.
Please do not worry, we will resolve this issue for you. Please provide us with a photo and your order number.

Im not sure if you seen the update I posted to this, but I found that the
load cell mount is cracked right at both screw holes where the load cell
attaches at. I believe thats the root cause of the bolt warping. Its really
hard to see it in any of the pictures of it, but it flexes an awful lot
when trying to engage the handbrake. I tried to get the best one I could of
it, and circled the area of the crack. Its cracked at the same spot on both
of the screw holes.



On Mon, Aug 25, 2025, 9:26 PM service@simsonn.com
SSN2368 is my order number
Curious if there was any updates
Hi w p,  You can remove it and take a photo of the damaged part for us. We will send you replacement parts and a new sensor for the damaged one, so please don’t worry.

I can here shortly when I get back home, but in the meantime I did pull it
apart and tried to weld the cracks. So in all technicality I did attempt to
fix it, so if I need to pay for the replacement mounting plate I will. The
sensor seems to function just fine, I have used it a decent amount of
times. It just seems a little weak on the travel and return from the split
plate. But like I said I'm willing to pay for the replacement if needed,
seeing as you're return/exchange policy says what it does about altering or
modifying the parts.

On Mon, Sep 15, 2025, 5:44 AM service@simsonn.com
Hi w p,  The screw specification for our HB Pro is: M8 × 80 with a thread length of 28mm.

So I ended up making a change to that part. Not too sure why it did but the
bolt would hang up in the load cell, I'm assuming catching the threads of
the load cell. I took the end end off of one of the dampeners I got with my
pedals set I didnt end up using, threaded a 6mm rod and left the end slick
like it is on the brake pedal and used some nylon bushings in the load cell
so it stays centered and shouldn't hang up anymore. After a couple hours of
use last night not an issue at all so far. May I suggest you guys think
about making that change? I think it'd be a better option and would avoid
similar issues happening for others.

So the first pic is how you guys currently have it with the exception its a
hex bolt in the Pic, and the 2nd is my set up. The black piece slides in
the load cell and it keeps the shaft of the bolt from riding on the threads
in the load cell. Keeps it nice and centered as it goes thru.
